column4: i just installed LAMP, but is there like a link or something to start it up? (like the start wamp in windows?)
Administration > Services
just make sure apache2 and mysql are checked (on)
i cant seem to locate apache2 in it
very bottom of the list?
if you don't see an option of "Web Server", it's not intalled
to install it i selected LAMP in synaptic : Edit->Mark Packages By Task and hit apply
search synaptic for 'apache2' and 'php' -- mark for installation
apache2 got everything installed that i know it needs
apache2, apache2-common, apache2-mpm-prefork etc
sudo /etc/init.d/apache2 start
its already running :O
thought so. it's not like windows; that stuff will be running automagically ;)
i rather have it not running on startup ;)
also /etc/init.d/mysql start if you want to be sure....
i use it to test some scripts locally before uploading to main server, not to actually host
it will retain the previous state. call /etc/init.d/apache2 stop to turn it off. do start next time you want it running. same with mysql
so if i turn it off, dont use it for a week, log on and off regularly, it will stay off till i turn it on manually?
or put the commands in a .sh file on your desktop and double click them like you did with wamp :)
THat has been my experience, yes.
ok thx :)
